Detailed Description

template<class T>
class BinaryTree< T >

An AVL Binary Search Tree.

Allows the use of an AVL Binary Search tree, as this tree is an AVL search tree it is self balancing.

Author:
Jake Kroon
Version:
01
Date:
18/05/2015
Bug:
No bugs to my knowledge

Member Function Documentation

template<class T>
void BinaryTree< T >::Insert ( T  newData  )  [inline]

Insert data into the BinaryTree.

Insert new data into the BinaryTree and will automatically sort the data. This requires the opertor < to be overloaded for the chosen data type.

Parameters:
newData - new data to be entered of the templated data type
Returns:
void

template<class T>
void BinaryTree< T >::InOrder ( void(*)(const T &data)  travFunc  )  [inline]

Processes the data in an in order way.

Traverses the binary BinaryTree in order, performs an operation on the data at each leaf

Parameters:
travFunc - A pointer to a function that will act on the data of each node
Returns:
void

template<class T>
bool BinaryTree< T >::Search ( T  key,
void(*)(const T &data)  searchFunc 
) [inline]

Searches for an object matching type T.

This is intended to be used with operator overloading for non primitive types. Searches for an object and returns it where a match is found. Returns NULL if object isn't found.

Parameters:
searchFunc - A pointer to a function that will act on the data at the node.
key - An object of type T to search for
Returns:
Object - An object of of type T that matches the key

template<class T>
BinaryTree< T > BinaryTree< T >::operator= ( const BinaryTree< T > &  rhs  )  [inline]

Makes a deep copied version of the BinaryTree being assigned.

Makes a new BinaryTree object that is a deep copy of the object on the right hand side of the = operator. This new BinaryTree object is then returned.

Parameters:
rhs - A constant reference to a BinaryTree object
Returns:
BinaryTree - A deep copy of the binary BinaryTree assigned
